contents.content:
enum RedirectType {
	moved_permanently  = int(http.Status.moved_permanently)
	found              = int(http.Status.found)
	see_other          = int(http.Status.see_other)
	temporary_redirect = int(http.Status.temporary_redirect)
	permanent_redirect = int(http.Status.permanent_redirect)
}
contents.name: RedirectType

comments.text:  The Context struct represents the Context which holds the HTTP request and response.
 It has fields for the query, form, files and methods for handling the request and response
 returns the request header data from the key

children.content: fn (ctx &Context) get_header(key http.CommonHeader) !string
children.name: get_header

comments.text:  returns the request header data from the key

children.content: fn (ctx &Context) get_custom_header(key string) !string
children.name: get_custom_header

comments.text:  set a header on the response object

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) set_header(key http.CommonHeader, value string)
children.name: set_header

comments.text:  set a custom header on the response object

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) set_custom_header(key string, value string) !
children.name: set_custom_header

comments.text:  send_response_to_client finalizes the response headers and sets Content-Type to `mimetype`
 and the response body to `response`

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) send_response_to_client(mimetype string, response string) Result
children.name: send_response_to_client

comments.text:  Response with payload and content-type `text/html`

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) html(s string) Result
children.name: html

comments.text:  Response with `s` as payload and content-type `text/plain`

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) text(s string) Result
children.name: text

comments.text:  Response with json_s as payload and content-type `application/json`

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) json[T](j T) Result
children.name: json

comments.text:  Response with a pretty-printed JSON result

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) json_pretty[T](j T) Result
children.name: json_pretty

comments.text:  Response HTTP_OK with file as payload

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) file(file_path string) Result
children.name: file

comments.text:  Response HTTP_OK with s as payload

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) ok(s string) Result
children.name: ok

comments.text:  send an error 400 with a message

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) request_error(msg string) Result
children.name: request_error

comments.text:  send an error 500 with a message

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) server_error(msg string) Result
children.name: server_error

comments.text:  Redirect to an url

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) redirect(url string, redirect_type RedirectType) Result
children.name: redirect

comments.text:  before_request is always the first function that is executed and acts as middleware

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) before_request() Result
children.name: before_request

comments.text:  returns a HTTP 404 response

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) not_found() Result
children.name: not_found

comments.text:  Gets a cookie by a key

children.content: fn (ctx &Context) get_cookie(key string) ?string
children.name: get_cookie

comments.text:  Sets a cookie

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) set_cookie(cookie http.Cookie)
children.name: set_cookie

comments.text:  set_content_type sets the Content-Type header to `mime`

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) set_content_type(mime string)
children.name: set_content_type

comments.text:  takeover_conn prevents vweb from automatically sending a response and closing
 the connection. You are responsible for closing the connection.
 In takeover mode if you call a Context method the response will be directly
 send over the connetion and you can send multiple responses.
 This function is usefull when you want to keep the connection alive and/or
 send multiple responses. Like with the SSE.

children.content: fn (mut ctx Context) takeover_conn()
children.name: takeover_conn

comments.text:  user_agent returns the user-agent header for the current client

children.content: fn (ctx &Context) user_agent() string
children.name: user_agent

comments.text:  Returns the ip address from the current user

children.content: fn (ctx &Context) ip() string
children.name: ip

contents.name: Context
ControllerPath

comments.text:  register_controller adds a new Controller to your app

children.content: fn (mut c Controller) register_controller[A, X](path string, mut global_app A) !
children.name: register_controller

comments.text:  register_controller adds a new Controller to your app

children.content: fn (mut c Controller) register_host_controller[A, X](host string, path string, mut global_app A) !
children.name: register_host_controller

comments.text:  controller generates a new Controller for the main app

contents.content: fn controller[A, X](path string, mut global_app A) !&ControllerPath
contents.name: controller

comments.text:  controller_host generates a controller which only handles incoming requests from the `host` domain

contents.content: fn controller_host[A, X](host string, path string, mut global_app A) &ControllerPath
contents.name: controller_host

contents.content:
struct Middleware[T] {
mut:
	global_handlers       []voidptr
	global_handlers_after []voidptr
	route_handlers        []RouteMiddleware
	route_handlers_after  []RouteMiddleware
}
contents.name: Middleware
MiddlewareOptions

comments.text:  string representation of Middleware

children.content: fn (m &Middleware[T]) str() string
children.name: str

comments.text:  use registers a global middleware handler

children.content: fn (mut m Middleware[T]) use(options MiddlewareOptions[T])
children.name: use

comments.text:  route_use registers a middlware handler for a specific route(s)

children.content: fn (mut m Middleware[T]) route_use(route string, options MiddlewareOptions[T])
children.name: route_use

comments.text:  encode_gzip adds gzip encoding to the HTTP Response body.
 This middleware does not encode files, if you return `ctx.file()`.
 Register this middleware as last!
 Example: app.use(vweb.encode_gzip[Context]())
 decode_gzip decodes the body of a gzip'ed HTTP request.
 Register this middleware before you do anything with the request body!
 Example: app.use(vweb.decode_gzip[Context]())

contents.name: StaticApp

comments.text:  StaticHandler provides methods to handle static files in your vweb App
 handle_static is used to mark a folder (relative to the current working folder)
 as one that contains only static resources (css files, images etc).
 If `root` is set the mount path for the dir will be in '/'
 Usage:
 os.chdir( os.executable() )?
 app.handle_static('assets', true)

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) handle_static(directory_path string, root bool) !bool
children.name: handle_static

comments.text:  host_handle_static is used to mark a folder (relative to the current working folder)
 as one that contains only static resources (css files, images etc).
 If `root` is set the mount path for the dir will be in '/'
 Usage:
 os.chdir( os.executable() )?
 app.host_handle_static('localhost', 'assets', true)

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) host_handle_static(host string, directory_path string, root bool) !bool
children.name: host_handle_static

comments.text:  mount_static_folder_at - makes all static files in `directory_path` and inside it, available at http://server/mount_path
 For example: suppose you have called .mount_static_folder_at('/var/share/myassets', '/assets'),
 and you have a file /var/share/myassets/main.css .
 => That file will be available at URL: http://server/assets/main.css .

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) mount_static_folder_at(directory_path string, mount_path string) !bool
children.name: mount_static_folder_at

comments.text:  host_mount_static_folder_at - makes all static files in `directory_path` and inside it, available at http://host/mount_path
 For example: suppose you have called .host_mount_static_folder_at('localhost', '/var/share/myassets', '/assets'),
 and you have a file /var/share/myassets/main.css .
 => That file will be available at URL: http://localhost/assets/main.css .

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) host_mount_static_folder_at(host string, directory_path string, mount_path string) !bool
children.name: host_mount_static_folder_at

comments.text:  Serves a file static
 `url` is the access path on the site, `file_path` is the real path to the file, `mime_type` is the file type

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) serve_static(url string, file_path string) !
children.name: serve_static

comments.text:  Serves a file static
 `url` is the access path on the site, `file_path` is the real path to the file
 `host` is the host to serve the file from

children.content: fn (mut sh StaticHandler) host_serve_static(host string, url string, file_path string) !
children.name: host_serve_static

contents.name: StaticHandler

comments.text:  A type which doesn't get filtered inside templates
 A dummy structure that returns from routes to indicate that you actually sent something to a user
 no_result does nothing, but returns `vweb.Result`. Only use it when you are sure
 a response will be send over the connection, or in combination with `Context.takeover_conn`

children.content: const methods_with_form = [http.Method.post, .put, .patch]

const mime_types = {
	'.aac':    'audio/aac'
	'.abw':    'application/x-abiword'
	'.arc':    'application/x-freearc'
	'.avi':    'video/x-msvideo'
	'.azw':    'application/vnd.amazon.ebook'
	'.bin':    'application/octet-stream'
	'.bmp':    'image/bmp'
	'.bz':     'application/x-bzip'
	'.bz2':    'application/x-bzip2'
	'.cda':    'application/x-cdf'
	'.csh':    'application/x-csh'
	'.css':    'text/css'
	'.csv':    'text/csv'
	'.doc':    'application/msword'
	'.docx':   'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document'
	'.eot':    'application/vnd.ms-fontobject'
	'.epub':   'application/epub+zip'
	'.gz':     'application/gzip'
	'.gif':    'image/gif'
	'.htm':    'text/html'
	'.html':   'text/html'
	'.ico':    'image/vnd.microsoft.icon'
	'.ics':    'text/calendar'
	'.jar':    'application/java-archive'
	'.jpeg':   'image/jpeg'
	'.jpg':    'image/jpeg'
	'.js':     'text/javascript'
	'.json':   'application/json'
	'.jsonld': 'application/ld+json'
	'.mid':    'audio/midi audio/x-midi'
	'.midi':   'audio/midi audio/x-midi'
	'.mjs':    'text/javascript'
	'.mp3':    'audio/mpeg'
	'.mp4':    'video/mp4'
	'.mpeg':   'video/mpeg'
	'.mpkg':   'application/vnd.apple.installer+xml'
	'.odp':    'application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.presentation'
	'.ods':    'application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.spreadsheet'
	'.odt':    'application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text'
	'.oga':    'audio/ogg'
	'.ogv':    'video/ogg'
	'.ogx':    'application/ogg'
	'.opus':   'audio/opus'
	'.otf':    'font/otf'
	'.png':    'image/png'
	'.pdf':    'application/pdf'
	'.php':    'application/x-httpd-php'
	'.ppt':    'application/vnd.ms-powerpoint'
	'.pptx':   'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation'
	'.rar':    'application/vnd.rar'
	'.rtf':    'application/rtf'
	'.sh':     'application/x-sh'
	'.svg':    'image/svg+xml'
	'.swf':    'application/x-shockwave-flash'
	'.tar':    'application/x-tar'
	'.tif':    'image/tiff'
	'.tiff':   'image/tiff'
	'.ts':     'video/mp2t'
	'.ttf':    'font/ttf'
	'.txt':    'text/plain'
	'.vsd':    'application/vnd.visio'
	'.wasm':   'application/wasm'
	'.wav':    'audio/wav'
	'.weba':   'audio/webm'
	'.webm':   'video/webm'
	'.webp':   'image/webp'
	'.woff':   'font/woff'
	'.woff2':  'font/woff2'
	'.xhtml':  'application/xhtml+xml'
	'.xls':    'application/vnd.ms-excel'
	'.xlsx':   'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet'
	'.xml':    'application/xml'
	'.xul':    'application/vnd.mozilla.xul+xml'
	'.zip':    'application/zip'
	'.3gp':    'video/3gpp'
	'.3g2':    'video/3gpp2'
	'.7z':     'application/x-7z-compressed'
}
const max_http_post_size = 1024 * 1024
const default_port = 8080

comments.text:  run - start a new VWeb server, listening to all available addresses, at the specified `port`

contents.content: fn run[A, X](mut global_app A, port int)
contents.name: run
RunParams

comments.text:  close the open file and reset the struct to its default values

children.content: fn (mut fr FileResponse) done()
children.name: done

comments.text:  free the current string and reset the struct to its default values

children.content: fn (mut sr StringResponse) done()
children.name: done

comments.text:  reset request parameters for `fd`:
 reset content-length index and the http request

children.content: fn (mut params RequestParams) request_done(fd int)
children.name: request_done

comments.text:  run_at - start a new VWeb server, listening only on a specific address `host`, at the specified `port`
 Example: vweb.run_at(new_app(), vweb.RunParams{ host: 'localhost' port: 8099 family: .ip }) or { panic(err) }

contents.content: fn run_at[A, X](mut global_app A, params RunParams) !
contents.name: run_at
